info.name: Wilg API
info.description: # ðŸš€ Get started here Don't forget to change the base_url variable if you change your laravel configuration : [http://127.0.0.1:8000/api](http://127.0.0.1:8000) ðŸ”– Routes in your disposition #### **1: Grades** Get all grade at disposition in application #### **2: Grade** Get on grade with name at disposition #### **3: Register** Register on wilg, don't forget to get a mailtrap. #### **4: Login** Login on the application with user at your disposition, check you database. #### **5: Me** Get the data for the current logged user #### **6: Auth Grade Cashback** Get the user data, with the cashback for the user plan and grade #### **7: Auth Grade Efficiency** Get the user data, with the efficiency for the user plan and grade #### **8: Logout** Logout the current user

request.description:
This is a GET request and it is used to "get" data from an endpoint. There is no request body for a GET request, but you can use query parameters to help specify the resource you want data on (e.g., in this request, we have `id=1`).

A successful GET response will have a `200 OK` status, and should include some kind of response body - for example, HTML web content or JSON data.
